posts.cooked:
Please don’t ruin Signal. These should be purely optional features. I don’t need any additional PIN in my life, and I don’t need Signal to train me to remember it (if anything, a secure password should be used for cloud storage, OPTIONALLY).

Instead, you should improve the way offline backups work. There still is no way to use MicroSD on Android for local Signal backups (which is really bad in case a backup happens to be larger than your phone’s remaining internal space, and there still is no way to create backups on iOS at all. Why?

The desktop version of Signal has no built-in backup feature, either (except for exporting individual attachments).

Please don’t ignore the overwhelmingly negative feedback regarding these features.
Thank you!

link_counts.title: Mandatory PIN: is Signal following the path of Digg?
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 3.9 release
Mandatory PIN without clear explanation within the app might cause significant number of users to quit using Signal
Mandatory PIN without clear explanation within the app might cause significant number of users to quit using Signal

posts.cooked: I agree with you completely.

Welcome to the forums.

There is already a large thread for opinions on PINs here: Mandatory PIN without clear explanation within the app might cause significant number of users to quit using Signal - #231 by haffenloher

Please post in there to keep the forums tidy. For what it’s worth, plenty of people agree with you and its been said countless times on the other thread.

link_counts.title: Mandatory PIN without clear explanation within the app might cause significant number of users to quit using Signal

posts.cooked: Well, this isn’t just about the PIN, it’s also about NOT wanting any information stored in the cloud, which becomes mandatory with this update.
Which is what the new PIN is for. It was introduced specifically to store information on the cloud.
No, it’s about registration lock, too. Indeed, these should be SEPARATE and optional features.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: But it’s mostly about the cloud
(post withdrawn by author, will be automatically deleted in 24 hours unless flagged)

What do you mean, still? It was only just introduced, despite the negative feedback in the respective beta thread. Is it really that funny that many people don’t want their personal info and contacts stored in the cloud?
Registration lock is part of the information that is stored using the new system. It’s all behind the PIN now.
The forum has a very specific set of users. It seems like most people are concerned with the reminders / setting a PIN in general. Not the cloud feature.

PrivacyFan:

There still is no way to use MicroSD on Android for local Signal backups

Can’t one mount the micro SD at /sdcard/Signal?

PrivacyFan:

there still is no way to create backups on iOS at all.

Announced as coming soon.

PrivacyFan:

The desktop version of Signal has no built-in backup feature

Yes but copying the data folder works.

jeremymasters:

But it’s mostly about the cloud

But also other stuff in the future. Who knows what that is going to be.

Gunter:

if only I can decrypt it

This is what I’m worried about. It’s not that the encryption scheme is bad or that PIN length is limited.

Contact info is synced and so I need to now worry about what kind of PINs my contacts are going to use because SGX isn’t unbreakable. I liked Signal as a tool for saying screw you to agencies conducting mass surveillance but if one SGX exploit is all it takes for them to get a lot of metadata then you can be sure they have plenty they can use.

Tursko:

Not the cloud feature.

That does seem to be the case.

newuser:

Announced as coming soon.

Where is this announcement that you keep claiming to have happened? I follow this forum pretty closely and don’t recall seeing that, though admittedly, I don’t pay as much attention to the iOS topics since I only use Android.
See the ios backup thread.

iOS: Backup / keeping message history when switching phones iOS Feature Requests
Yes, it will happen soon enough that waiting a few weeks is a viable option. Make sure you keep access to your old device with your message history.

link_counts.title: iOS Backups / Keeping message history when resetting phone

posts.cooked:
Thanks @Tursko !

So it sounds more like just a history transfer from old to new device rather than “local backups” that you can restore at any time.

I am just a regular user who did not follow Signal’s development and I, like many others did not learn about this issue until now.
What I find surprising is that the powers that be thought it would be a good idea to introduce both this PIN and cloud saving (which seems like a departure from what Signal aims to be [a completely private messenger where you alone control your data]), without making it OPTIONAL. It’s nice to offer additional features (and security) for those who want them, but there is no reason to make it mandatory.
I agree but more than likely it’s gonna become optional at some point.
What gives you this impression when the team has stated in Github and here the exact opposite?

posts.name: github.jpc
posts.cooked:
Can I suggest a revolutionary feature for the next Signal release? Enhanced privacy options.

Signal could respect its users’ privacy choices by not forcing them to allow remote storage of their Signal data. Just a thought.
